title: Paris mayoral election campaign gets bogged down in controversy
subhead: With one month until the election, the leading candidates are still struggling to gain traction for their local platforms, which have been overshadowed by national debates.

title: Former Prince Andrew arrested for several hours by police, marking a historic event in the United Kingdom
Trump sees 'maximum' 15 days for Iran to make deal
Italy, the United Kingdom and Japan hope to bring Germany on board their next-generation fighter jet project
subhead: The arrival of a new partner would provide a valuable boost to backers of the Global Combat Air Programme (GCAP), as the cost of the project has turned out to be higher than anticipated.

title: 'Paradoxically, the French economy is experiencing a renewed sense of optimism'
subhead: Despite a worrying national and international context, there have been several positive signals from business leaders, notably driven by the defense and aerospace industries, observes Le Monde journalist Béatrice Madeline.

title: Eric Dane, 'Grey's Anatomy' star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
subhead: The actor received his big break when he was cast as Dr. Mark Sloan, aka McSteamy, on 'Grey's Anatomy.' After announcing his ALS diagnosis in April 2025, Dane became a committed advocate for people living with the disease.

title: Real or faux, vintage or new, fur is no longer hiding
subhead: Even though imitation now dominates the market, secondhand pieces made from real fur are once again in high demand, as are sheepskin and lambskin. According to animal rights advocates, these alternatives still fuel the desire for materials that should be banned.

title: Trump says he's ordering release of data on UFOs and aliens
In Dhaka, Sheikh Hasani's palace has been turned into a museum honoring victims of the July 2024 uprising
USA's Alysa Liu wins the gold in Olympic women's figure skating
Trump's Board of Peace opens with $10 billion pledge and troops for Gaza
USA beat Canada 2-1 to win Olympic women's ice hockey gold medal
'Lawless zones around Israel are the result of the Pax Judaica made possible by uncontested military hegemony'
From the Château de Versailles to the Elysée, the unshakable Catherine Pégard
Nestlé exits ice cream market and partially withdraws from bottled water
Tom Fletcher: 'Anyone who says the UN is dead should spend some time with my colleagues in Sudan or DRC'
Airbus aims for record aircraft deliveries in 2026
French prosecutor seeks homicide charges in far-right activist killing
In India, Macron calls on French 'extremist parties' to 'clean house' over death of far-right activist
Gaza's local authorities massively underreported deaths, says international research team
subhead: The first independent field study on Gaza to not involve local authorities, published in The Lancet Global Health on Wednesday, concludes that the number of violent deaths linked to the conflict has been underreported by about 35%.

title: Xavier Dolan, filmmaker: "Where does the idea that artists should 'stay out of politics' come from?"
subhead: A controversy is stirring at this year's Berlinale. At their opening press conference, the jury members declined to comment on the situation in Palestine, with their president, Wim Wenders, arguing that cinema should 'stay out of politics.' Canadian director Xavier Dolan responds to him in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: Epstein files hand French prosecutors trove of new leads
subhead: The Paris prosecutor's office opened two investigations on Wednesday: one into 'human trafficking' and the other regarding 'financial offenses such as money laundering, breaches of probity, or tax fraud.'

title: 'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
Patrick Artus: 'The unpopular reforms France nevertheless needs to undertake'
Paul Magnette, political scientist: 'If Trump's camp felt superior, why try and divide Europe?'
